member.name: OLECLOSE
member.summary: Indicates whether an object should be saved before closing.

member.name: OLECLOSE.OLECLOSE_SAVEIFDIRTY
member.summary: The object should be saved if it is dirty.

member.name: OLECLOSE.OLECLOSE_NOSAVE
member.summary: The object should not be saved, even if it is dirty. This flag is typically used when an object is being deleted.

member.name: OLECLOSE.OLECLOSE_PROMPTSAVE
member.summary: If the object is dirty, the implementation should display a dialog box to let the end user determine whether to save the object. However, if the object is in the running state but its user interface is invisible, the end user should not be prompted, and the close should be handled as if OLECLOSE_SAVEIFDIRTY had been specified.
